qas.question: What private school, with the notable distinction of being the fifth-oldest educational institution in the U.S., was founded in New Haven?
In what year was Hopkins School founded in New Haven?
What is the name of the environmental charter school located in New Haven?
What are the names of the two Achievement First charter schools located in New Haven?

answers.text: Amistad Academy and Elm City College Prep

qas.question: What magnet school in New Haven is centered around arts education?

answers.text: ACES Educational Center for the Arts

qas.question: As one of the oldest school which was founded in 1660, what is it's name?
In terms of schools how old is it historically compare to others?
How many charters schools are available in New Haven?

context: <a0_0><a5_0>Hopkins School<a5_0/><a0_0/>, a private school, was founded in <a1_0>1660<a1_0/> and is the <a6_0>fifth-oldest<a6_0/> educational institution in the United States. New Haven is home to a number of other private schools as well as public magnet schools, including Metropolitan Business Academy, High School in the Community, Hill Regional Career High School, Co-op High School, New Haven Academy, <a4_0>ACES Educational Center for the Arts<a4_0/>, the Foote School and the Sound School, all of which draw students from New Haven and suburban towns. New Haven is also home to <a7_0>two<a7_0/> Achievement First charter schools, <a3_0>Amistad Academy and Elm City College Prep<a3_0/>, and to <a2_0>Common Ground<a2_0/>, an environmental charter school.
